turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Madha (Lok Sabha constituency).
turn.1: What is the meaning of Madha (Lok Sabha constituency)?
turn.2: Madha (Lok Sabha constituency) Madha Lok Sabha constituency is one of the 48 Lok Sabha (lower house of Indian parliament) constituencies of Maharashtra state in western India.
turn.4: This constituency was created on 19 February 2008 as a part of the implementation of the Presidential notification based on the recommendations of the Delimitation Commission of India constituted on 12 July 2002.
turn.5: Who was the first person to be elected under this constituency?
turn.6: It first held elections in 2009 and its first member of parliament (MP) was Sharad Pawar of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP).
turn.8: As of the 2014 elections, the constituency's current MP is Vijaysinh Mohite–Patil also of the NCP.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: At present, Madha Lok Sabha constituency comprises six Vidhan Sabha (legislative assembly) segments.
